channel.title: Note on caodoc
channel.description: Recent content in Note on caodoc

item.title: A little update about me (Winter 2024)
item.description:
Cause, why not?

3 months ago, I only dared to dream of getting into my dream university - HCMUS. Now that I’m halfway through the first semester in HCMUS, I want to reflect on the experience so far.

Math is hard

Math here is freaking hard. I was and still struggling to keep up with the pace of the lectures. I’m not sure if I can make it through the semester.

item.title: GitHub Unwrapped 2023
item.description:
Created on GitHub Unwrapped, you can find anything related there.

Result

Summary

Top language:

  1. C++
  2. Javascript
  3. Python

Issues:

  • Opened: 1.
  • Closed: 1.

Others

  • Contributions: 463.
  • Most productive day: Thursday.
  • Most productive hour: 1pm.
  • Pull requests merged: 7.
  • Repository Stared: 111.

Many happened this year: my coding skills improved, I have remade some basic front-end websites, etc.. Kind of a successful year for me I guess.

Anyways, Happy New Year 2024!

item.title: Reimu In A Nutshell
item.description:
Yes, this is a shitpost (I have lost my mind after the final exams of the 12th grade first semester).

About the gif below, I used media-to-ascii to convert the original to ascii video.

⚠ Attention: I do not own any of these media, these were I found around the Internet.

Me during the exams:

Reimu dancing

Reimu hugging

Reimu in the Winter

Reimu eating

Reimu wishing you a nice day!

item.title: This website's older versions
item.description:
1.0:

  • Release date: June 2023.
  • This is the first version of my website when I started to learn front-end development. I glad it worked when I saw it online.
  • Go to page

2.0 & 3.0:

  • Release date: July 2023.
  • As a beginner, I wanted to practice more with more complexity, so I made 2.0 and 3.0. I struggled while trying to make it responsive but it worked somehow.
  • Go to page

4.0 (current version):

  • Release date: August 2023.
  • I saw my friend using this rissoto theme and I loved how it looks so I decided to give it a try and I didn’t regret it (I modified the theme to as it looks now and named it Chloe).

item.title: How to install Oh My Posh on Windows
item.description:
About Oh My Posh

Oh My Posh is a prompt theme engine for any shell, makes your terminal looks better than its default interface.

For example:

Installation

  1. Oh My Posh:

To download ohmyposh.exe and all the themes, open a powershell window and run:

winget install JanDeDobbeleer.OhMyPosh -s winget
  1. Font:

After that, you will need a suitable font. I recommend you should use Fire Code font.

Setting up

  1. Font:

You can change the font on the terminal by doing:

item.title: My PC's Configuration
item.description:
Last Updated: 24 November 2024

Windows:

Tweak:

  • Free computer’s resources: ChrisTitusTech/winutil & Winaero Tweaker.
  • Remove unnecessary apps: Bloatbox.

Editor:

  1. Visual Studio Code
  • Theme: One Dark Pro.
  • Extensions: Competitive Programming Helper, CodeSnap, Better Comments.
  1. Visual Studio 2022
  • Theme: Doki Theme
  • Extensions: Output Enhancer.

Apps:

  • Crystal Disk Info: Disks utility software.
  • Everything: Better files/folders search.
  • Notepad++: Extra text editor.
  • K-Lite Codec: Media player.
  • Oh My Posh: Customize Windows terminal, you can read my note on how to install Oh My Posh here.
  • PowerTunnel: An extensible proxy server.

Ubuntu:

Coming soon…
